alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 5:12PM EDT until June 09 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan and Chatham. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rains extending from Richmond Hill through Silk Hope to Riverside. Between 1 to 2 inches of rain could fall in a very short period through 645 PM, resulting in urban flooding and minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Richmond Hill, Hunter Army Airfield, Windsor Forest, Downtown Savannah, Midtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Hutchinson Island, Savannah International Airport, Wilmington Island, Fort Pulaski National Monument, Montgomery, Garden City, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, White Bluff, Savannah Historic District and Sandfly.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
